name: Hotel Bucintoro

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.text: The hotel was in a great location with a view that could not be beat. The staff was helpful with all information and recommended a wonderful restaurant and Vivaldi concert during our stay. The room was well appointed and the decor was that of being on a shop with warm woods and bronze details.

reviews.title: Overrated
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights in early October.

reviews.title: Perfect Location
reviews.text: The location is great - slightly away from the crowds of St Marks. The room was strictly utilitarian and cramped. As is common in Italy the matress was rock hard. The view is nice but only out of a small window if you stand in front of it. The main concierge was quite pushy. We went to their recommended restaurant the first night and it was good. Following nights when trying to get help with reservations he kept trying to get us to go back to the same place.

reviews.title: Perfect Bucintoro
reviews.text: This hotel was in the perfect location for our trip to Venice. 10 mins walk to Saint Marks Square. 150m away from vaporetto to Airport, Bus terminal, Saint Marks, Rialto, Murano etc.

reviews.title: Perfect Hotel and Staff
reviews.text: Staff are very polite and knowledgeable. Rooms were spacious (family room ) and very clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just spent 3 nights at this wonderful hotel. The location was great being located on the grand canal, short walk to St Mark's Square, Vaporetto stop right near the hotel, all rooms overlook the Grand Canal and good value restaurants just around the corner on Via Garibaldi which are a bit away from the tourist zone with locals eating there. The front desk staff, in particular Stefano, went out of their way to help. We strongly recommend this hotel without reservation.
reviews.title: Great location, incredibly helpful staff and lovely room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights towards the end of September and loved this hotel. It is a short (10 mins max) walk from San Marco so close to everything but a lovely retreat from the madding crowds at the end of a busy day. Great views over the lagoon and very helpful and friendly staff - would highly recommend!
reviews.title: An oasis!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a spacious room which had a really lovely view back towards the Grand Canal and a window large enough to appreciate it. The Bucintoro was quiet, clean and very well located - an easy walk to St Marks and within a few steps of Arsenale Vaporetto stop. From the station the 4.2 route is faster but misses out the Grand Canal - so if you have time take the 1 to get the full effect of Venice on your way in.
reviews.title: Marvellous location with staff to match

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very pleasant and helped us find a well priced local option for dinner. Breakfast was fresh and there was plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just misses out on excellent though because there was no effective temperature control on the shower - hot or hot.
reviews.title: Highly recommend this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very good (and expensive) luxury hotel in a very good location in Venice.
reviews.title: perfect hotel in perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is located in the Castello neighborhood near the “Arsenal” stop of both the vaporetto (the water bus) and the “blue line” boat from the airport.
reviews.title: A fabulous stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That means that you can reach it from the Airport or the train and bus stations or the parking areas by public transport without having to change.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have luggage this is significant.
reviews.title: Loved it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the “Arsenal” stop to the hotel it is a 3 minutes walk. If your luggage is heavy and you are old and/or weak, take into account that you have to cross a bridge, better ask the hotel to meet you at the vaporetto stop.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for here
What an incredible view!
reviews.text: Me and my husband spent a romantic weekend at this hotel at the end of Sept.,an excellent stay started from the very beginning because we got a free room upgrade...ours was a corner room with an astonishing view on the lagoon and the close isles plus Saint Mark's Square.It is a very quiet hotel close to a water bus stop nearly in front of the hotel's main entrance in a very easy walking distance to the major spots of interest-more or less six minutes by walk from Saint Mark-and yet far from the hassle of the tourist area,close to a natural park and a street -Via Garribaldi-full of useful shops,a bank with an ATM,some cheap restaurants and an excellent ice cream shop.The lobby is small but truly elegant,the whole hotel is decorated in naval style like if it was a ship.The view from our room was simply breathtaking..we left our windows open due to the warm temperatures but by night it was incredibly quiet.We relied on the advices given us by the cool front office manager by name Stefano but we found each member of the staff truly polite and helpful,speaking an excellent English as well as other foreign languages.The hotel has a pretty breakfast room,a free Wi-fi connection in room,a working a/c...in our good size room,the extra clean bathroom was in red marble,we had enough room to store our luggage,a comfortable large bed,a flat screen Tv with various channels..a delightful stay in a perfect hotel we strongly recommend.

reviews.title: Great Location and Staff
reviews.text: Had a great stay at this hotel and would recommend it highly. The rooms are not large but they are very clean and the location is outstanding. It has great views of the bay. Only a short walk from the center of Venice but out of the noisy busy tourist area. Had breakfast in the room twice which was nice (small extra cost). Overall good value for Venice which is expensive. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Changed a few dollars for euros here at a rate not far off the Change Bureaus and a lot easier.

reviews.title: Great Location/Service
reviews.text: As said by many others, the hotel is in a great location. Right on the water, and away from the throngs at St. Marks. I'd have to disagree with complaints about the service; we found everyone to be helpful and accomodating. They had a nice breakfast area, and the food was good (you have to pay a little extra for eggs but really very reasonable). Internet is included, which is also a major plus!

reviews.title: Will return again soon
reviews.text: The main problem the hotel has is the facility itself. Yes, the rooms are small and that is expected. Beds are a bit hard but that is personal preference. The major problem is that the bathroom had a significant mold smell to it, to the point where we really kept the windows open all the time and the bathroom door closed.

reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.text: I am not sure whether this is a problem with all rooms, or just the one we were in.

description: Facing the San Marco Docks right near Piazza San Marco, Hotel Bucintoro embraces the maritime lifeblood of Venice with charming spaces inspired by ancient sailboats and galleys that once bobbed right in front of the hotel. An elegant 4-star hotel in the historic center of Venice, Hotel Bucintoro offers rooms, junior suites and suites overlooking San Marco, embellished with the necessary comforts and services...
